channel.title: Faulty Windows Update "KB2735855" can lead to issues!
channel.description:
ATTENTION users who are experiencing broken cube / maps / textures / props, missing weapon models, a [b]high[/b] frequency of crashes. You may be a victim of a bad download due to dropped packets and faulty download execution within your browser as a result of a recent Microsoft Windows Update "KB2735855"!
Microsoft has acknowledged that the WINDOWS Update "KB2735855" (for windows 7/8 [32 and 64bit]) is faulty. This update can lead to corrupted downloads within your browser. This [b]could[/b] explain some of the problems that our users are seeing with a functioning but extremely buggy game. The support site for the update is here: [url]https://support.microsoft.com/kb/2735855[/url] Please read and choose if this applies to you.
Advise:
[b]For users not experiencing any of the above[/b] 1) Just Remove / uninstall the Windows update KB2735855 2) Go on with your life
For users that ARE experiencing problems outlined above, please follow these instructions
1) Remove / uninstall the Windows update KB2735855
2) Back up your Black Mesa save files
3) Uninstall/Remove Black Mesa by deleting the BMS folder found here: \Steam\steamapps\sourcemods\BMS
4) Re download Black Mesa:
a) Torrent: [url]https://www.mediafire.com/?khmzyygg4vetko0[/url]
b) Gamefront: [url]https://www.gamefront.com/black-mesa-is-live-download-it-here[/url]
i) Scroll down to see three separate download links. Download all three.
The complete game installation package consists of the three files:
1) blackmesa.7z 2) BlackMesa.md5 3) blackmesa-setup.exe
5) Install Black Mesa game by clicking on blackmesa-setup.exe and be sure it is installed to this directory:
\Steam\steamapps\sourcemods\BMS
6) Launch Steam and find the game "Black Mesa" listed in your games library
[b]Note: You may also need to check the Source SDK 2007 install base in steam for consistency[/b]
Thank you, and have a very safe and productive day!
:bms: The Black Mesa Team :bms:
